articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects KPA Unit
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il inspected Unit No. 681 under the KPA Artillery Command and watched its firing exercise.
					He was greeted on the spot by Col. General Ri Jong Bu, KPA Artillery commander, and other general officers and commanding officers of the unit.
					
					He acquainted himself with the unit's performance of duty. Then he mounted an observation platform where he was briefed on the plan for the exercise by the artillery commander and watched it. 
					
					The one-match-for-a-hundred artillerymen's exercise clearly showed the resolute determination of the servicemen to crush the aggressors at a single blow when they dare intrude into the DPRK even 0.001mm and their merciless striking capability.
					
					After watching the exercise conducted by the brave servicemen firmly armed with the ever-victorious Juche-based war methods, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that all the servicemen are fully prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique to beat back any enemy's surprise invasion in time and defend the socialist homeland like an impregnable fortress.
					
					He highly estimated their successful exercise and set forth important tasks which would serve as guidelines for further developing the KPA into invincible revolutionary armed forces.
					
					The KPA, a successor to the brilliant traditions of the anti-Japanese war, has grown not only to be an army strong in ideology as it regards the spirit of devotedly defending the leader, the spirit of becoming human bullets and bombs as unshakable faith but to be powerful revolutionary armed forces equipped with modern offensive and defensive means enough to wipe out the enemies at a single blow no matter from which part of the earth they come to invade the DPRK, he said, adding: The socialist homeland is impregnable and its cause of building a great prosperous powerful nation is firmly guaranteed as its defence line is guarded by this invincible army, which has grown strong in the protracted and arduous struggle.
					
					 He met the servicemen who took part in the exercise and warmly encouraged them, before having a photo session with them.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Kim Yong Chun, minister of the People's Armed Forces of the NDC of the DPRK, KPA General Ri Yong Ho, chief of the KPA General Staff, KPA General Kim Jong Gak, first vice-director of the KPA General Political Bureau, and KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae, Kim Myong Guk and Ri Myong Su and other commanding officers of the army and Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and Jang Song Thaek, Pak Nam Gi and Kim Yang Gon, department directors of the C.C., the WPK, and other senior officials of the society.

articles.title: Minister of People's Armed Forces and Chief of General Staff Newly Appointed in DPRK
articles.content:
Minister of People's Armed Forces and Chief of General Staff Newly Appointed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A decision of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea was released on February 11 in the name of Kim Jong Il, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and chairman of the WPK Central Military Commission.
					Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Chun was appointed as minister of the People's Armed Forces of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and KPA General Ri Yong Ho as chief of the KPA General Staff, according to the decision.

articles.title: Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the economic and commercial councilors' corps here on the occasion of his birthday.
					 They were conveyed to an official concerned by Enrique Gomez Soler, commercial councilor of the Cuban embassy who is a doyen of the corps, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Various Places
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Various Places
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here visited the Revolutionary Museum of the Ministry of Culture on Wednesday on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The guests laid bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung standing at the Korean Film Studio before paying tribute to him.
					
					At the museum they looked round historic relics and materials on display, being briefed on the fact that Kim Jong Il set forth the original idea on developing culture and arts in a Juche-oriented way and has wisely led the work for materializing it.
					
					They also visited the venue of the national art exhibition celebrating February 16.
					
					On the same day the economic and commercial councilors' corps here visited the Pyongyang Cultural Exhibition.
					
					After going round photos on the exploits of Kim Jong Il, the guests saw works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and books introducing the politics, economy, culture and history of Korea, etc.

articles.title: 10-Day Film Show Opens
articles.content:
10-Day Film Show Opens
Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A 10-day film show was opened with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture today to celebrate February 16, the birthday of General Secretary
					Kim Jong Il.
					In the period of the show, films vividly portraying undying leadership exploits performed by
						Kim Jong Il and the indomitable mental power being displayed by the army and people in the DPRK in building a rich and powerful nation will be screened at cinemas and cultural houses in Pyongyang and different parts of the country.
					
					Among them are documentary films "Kim Jong Il Gives Field Guidance to Various Sectors", "Cherishing the Leader's Desire" and "February 16, the Greatest Holiday of the Korean Nation."
					
					Feature films including "Photograph Left by Him", "Airman Kil Yong Jo", "People in Jagang Province", "Taehongdan County's Chief Party Secretary" and "A Schoolgirl's Dairy" will also be screened.
					
					Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, made an opening address.
					
					After the ceremony the participants watched feature film "Appearance of Soldier."
					
					 Similar film shows were opened in different provinces on the same day.

articles.title: National Art Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
National Art Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A national art exhibition was opened on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il which falls on February 16. 
					 Displayed in the venue of the exhibition are at least 70 works listed as national treasures and other art works depicting the revolutionary feats of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu and their personalities as great persons.
					
					Korean paintings "February holiday on the threshold of the country's liberation" and "To the homeland" deal with the immortal feats President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese heroine, performed by letting the bright star of Paektu shed its rays and enabling the Korean nation to be blessed with the illustrious leaders generation after generation.
					
					Acryl paintings "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il visiting the construction site of the Samjiyon Grand Monument", "O Korea, I will add glory to thee" and others successfully portray the peerless greatness of Kim Jong Il.
					
					The visitors are deeply impressed to see an oil painting "The great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il visiting workers of the Taean Heavy Machine Complex", a Korean painting "Praising it as spectacular landscape in the era of Songun" and other works dealing with his great leadership art characterized by his patriotic devotion.
					
					An opening ceremony took place at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Wednesday.
					
					Present at the opening ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, art creators and working people in the city.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam made an inaugural address.

articles.title: Congratulations to AU Chairman
articles.content:
Congratulations to AU Chairperson
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on February 11 sent a congratulatory message to Moammer el Gaddafi, leader of the Revolution of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, on his election as chairperson of the AU at the 12th ordinary session of the assembly of heads of state and government of the African Union.
					The DPRK government and people are convinced that this assembly marked an important occasion in further strengthening the AU, successively solving such regional issues as socio-economic development and disputes by the concerted efforts of the African countries and promoting the development of the infrastructure of the continent, Kim noted in the message, expressing the will to invariably boost the traditional friendly and cooperative relations with the AU and its member states.
					
					 The message hoped that the AU would register success in its efforts to achieve unity and cooperation among its member states and the integration, peace and prosperity of the continent in the future thanks to the active role of the chairperson.

articles.title: Greetings to Iranian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian President
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, President of Iran, on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the victory of the Islamic revolution in Iran.
					 Kim in the message said that since the victory of the revolution the Iranian people have made great successes in the efforts to foil the moves of hostile forces for pressure and interference in internal affairs, defend the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation and achieve its welfare. And he wished the president greater success in his noble work for defending the gains of the Islamic revolution and building powerful Iran. 
					
					 He expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Iran developing on good terms as the days go by would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to First Vice-President of Iran
articles.content:
Greetings to First Vice-President of Iran
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Kim Yong Il Wednesday sent a message of greetings to First Vice-President Parviz Davudi on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the victory of the Islamic revolution in Iran.
					 The message expressed belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the future, too, and sincerely wished the friendly Iranian people prosperity and welfare.

articles.title: Iranian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Iranian Ambassador Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Morteza Moradian hosted a reception on Feb. 10 on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the victory of the Islamic revolution in Iran.
					 Present there on invitation were Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, Vice-Foreign Minister Kim Yong Il, Vice-Minister of Oil Industry Jong Chol Yun, Vice-Chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Jon Yong Jin, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Staff members of the Iranian embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Football Match between DPRK and Saudi Arabia Held
articles.content:
Football Match between DPRK and Saudi Arabia Held
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A football match between the DPRK and Saudi Arabia teams, the Asian final preliminary for FIFA 2010 World Cup, was held at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang on Feb. 11.
					 The DPRK team defeated its rival 1:0.

articles.title: School Youth and Children Make Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites and Historic Sites
articles.content:
School Youth and Children Make Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites and Historic Sites
Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- School youth and children from across the country visited General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan secret camp and made study tour of revolutionary battle sites and historic sites in the period from Feb. 4 to 10.
					They laid floral baskets and flowers before the statues of President Kim Il Sung at the Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site and the Chongbong Bivouac and on the shore of Lake Samji and paid profound tribute to him.
					
					At the Phochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site they deeply grasped the undying feats performed by
						Kim Il Sung who imbued the Korean people with faith in sure victory by making a gunreport calling for annihilating the enemies in the homeland.
					
					They visited the spring in Poso-ri, table land in Junghung, the Photae and Rimyongsu Revolutionary Sites and the Chongbong and Konchang Bivouacs. During this period they held a presentation on the reminiscences of anti-Japanese guerrillas, contest of group singing of revolutionary songs during the march, contest of publication of flashnews on successes in the march and question and answer contest, etc. 
					
					The school youth and children, who visited the Paektusan secret camp, sacred place of revolution, went round with keen interest the historical mementoes which are preserved at the old home with good care, being briefed on the fact that Kim Jong Il was born in a simple log cabin and grown up to be a great revolutionary.
					
					Upon their arrival at Samjiyon County they went round various revolutionary relics, being briefed on the Samjiyon Grand Monument. Then they visited different places of the county township including Paektu Hall and the Samjiyon Schoolchildren's Palace, deeply grasping the wise leadership provided by Kim Jong Il who brought about eye-opening changes to the historic land.

articles.title: Crowded Ice Sports Training Center
articles.content:
Crowded Ice Sports Training Center
Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A lot of people visit the Ice Sports Training Center located on the picturesque bank of the River Pothong flowing across Pyongyang.
					In the centre school youth and children are skating on the ice-rink, children playing like figure-skaters and adults teaching skating skills to them. Spectacular is the scene, indeed.
					
					The center opened in February Juche 73 (1984) is one of the sports centers for developing sports science and technology of the country and promoting the physical fitness of children and people.
					
					In the centre with a floor space of 12,000 square meters and an icy ground of more than 3,000 square meters people can practice various events of ice sports such as ice hockey, figure and speed skating all the year round. It is equipped well with all public service facilities including resting rooms, saunas, drying rooms and a dispensary.
					
					Ice drilling apparatuses are provided by the center at state expense.
					
					According to an employee of the center it, with a capacity of 400-500 people a day, is haunted by lots of people above the capacity nowadays.
					
					A great number of working people and school youth and children as well as athletes are building up their physical strength and polishing their ice sports skills to their hearts' content.

articles.title: Israel's Use of WMDs against Palestinian Civilians Flayed
articles.content:
Israel's Use of WMDs against Palestinian Civilians Flayed
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Israeli aggressors were reported recently not only to have indiscriminately fired white phosphorous shells as well as depleted uranium shells the use of which is strictly banned internationally against civilian areas, but used DIME newly developed by the U.S. during their invasion of the Gaza Strip. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: They fired missiles and perpetrated saturation air raids over a peaceful city and attacked it with tanks under the pretext of wiping out Hamas armed forces. Not content with this operation, they perpetrated such genocide by using even internationally banned weapons. These are the worst human rights abuses in the world.
					
					Citing facts to prove that Israel has been hell-bent on the military aggression against Palestine and mass killings of its civilians by use of lethal weapons supplied by the U.S., while behaving in the same way as the U.S. has abused human rights, perpetrating high-handed and arbitrary acts in utter disregard of international law and human rights, the commentary goes on:
					
					The indiscriminate use of WMDs by the U.S. imperialists and the Israeli aggressors defying the protest of the world public fully disclosed the bestial nature of those who are keen on aggression and war and mass killings. This once again proves that they are the man-killers of the same type whose job is to abuse human rights and the heinous enemies of humankind. 
					
					 The U.S. oft-repeats "respect for human rights" under the eyes of the world but it utterly disregards the idea of abiding by international law and respecting human rights when it comes to its aggressive and predatory aim. 
					
					 A typical example of this is that the U.S. has not only used the above-said WMDs but delivered them to Israel, thus driving it to indiscriminately using them against civilians and causing horrible disasters.
					
					 Israel is making much pain to cover up its human rights abuses but it can never escape from a stern judgment by the justice-loving international community.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK Confrontational Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Anti-DPRK Confrontational Remarks under Fire
Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group is getting more provocative, decrying this or that way the statement issued by the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in denunciation of the acts of treachery the group has perpetrated by pushing the inter-Korean relations to the brink of a war.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					The group challenged the just measures taken by the DPRK, issuing the order to "strengthen the alert posture," talking about "threat" and the like and crying out for "strongly reacting" to someone's "intrusion into the northern limit line". This is nothing but rhetoric intended to justify its moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK which have driven the inter-Korean relations into the crisis of collapse and push them to the brink of a war, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 In the past the north and south authorities had adopted agreements on putting an end to the state of political and military confrontation including the issues of respecting each other's ideologies and systems, stopping slanders and calumnies each other and preventing armed conflicts. But none of them had been implemented due to the dictatorial regimes of south Korea forsaken by the people.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime which emerged under the signboard of "pragmatism," in particular, has turned down and completely scrapped the points of the inter-Korean agreements by reducing them to dead documents through the worst policies of confrontation with the DPRK in history.
					
					 The traitorous clique has desperately resorted to such anti-DPRK operations as "human rights" campaign, spread of leaflets and smear broadcasting, while openly advocating "unification under the liberal democratic system." It went the lengths of kicking up a racket for a war of aggression against the DPRK, talking about even what it called "emergency situation" and "preemptive attack".
					
					All these moves for confrontation with the DPRK led to nullifying all the agreements adopted between the north and the south.
					
					 The CPRK issued a statement in which it declared totally null and void all agreements on removing political and military confrontation between the north and the south and nullified the provisions concerning the maritime military boundary in the West Sea. This was a just and legitimate measure for self-defence taken in view of this reality.
					
					 Nevertheless, the group of traitors is getting evermore frantic with its anti-DPRK confrontational racket, slandering its proper measure. This clearly proves that the group is keen to ignite a war against the DPRK at any cost in league with foreign forces, pursuant to its treacherous policy of confrontation with compatriots.
					
					 The group will be held fully accountable for the disastrous consequences to be entailed by its reckless moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK, warns the commentary.

articles.title: State Centralized and Unified Guidance Is Lifeline of Socialist Economy
articles.content:
State Centralized and Unified Guidance Is Lifeline of Socialist Economy
Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- It is the steadfast policy of the Workers' Party of Korea to adhere to the socialist principle in economic management and give full play to the advantages of socialist economy in order to develop the country's economy, says Rodong Sinmun today in a signed article.
					It goes on:
					
					The state centralized and unified guidance over the economic construction is the mode of the socialist economic management whereby the socialist state puts under its control the overall economic work on the basis of the Party's line and policies and makes sure that all the economic institutions and industrial establishments conduct their business administration according to the coordinating plan and command of the state.
					
					The state centralized and unified guidance over economy is an essential requirement and lifeline of socialist economy which is based on collectivism.
					
					To strengthen the said guidance is a basic guarantee for thoroughly adhering to the socialist principle in economic construction and consolidating the socialist economic system.
					
					When the socialist principle is not abided by in economic work, it is impossible to maintain the economic foundation of socialism, nor is it possible to build an economic power and defend the socialist system.
					
					The WPK has wisely led economic construction our own way on the principle of Juche, the socialist principle, even during the "Arduous March", the forced march. It was thanks to the principled leadership of the WPK that we could firmly defend the banner of socialism under the grim and complicated situation and usher in a new historic era of building a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					It is the basic principle of the socialist economic management to manage and operate the economy of the country in a planned way under the state centralized and unified guidance.
					
					If the function of the state guidance is allowed to weaken, the capitalist elements may penetrate and grow in the economic field, putting the socialist economic management in disorder and harming the socialist economic system.
					
					Strengthening the state centralized and unified guidance over economic construction helps give fullest play to the advantages of socialist economy and concentrate force and natural resources on projects which are of weighty significance in the overall economic development, in particular, and thus increase production in a short span of time.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Work for Independent Reunification
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Work for Independent Reunification
Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The banner of Songun held aloft by the Workers' Party of Korea, which is ushering in a brilliant heyday of Songun Korea sounding the general advance, serves as a great banner of the nation as it instills immense national pride, self-esteem and honor into all Koreans in the north and the south and abroad and vigorously accelerates the advance of an era of independent reunification. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					The Songun policy of General Secretary Kim Jong Il today serves as a great symbol of independence and dignity, an invincible shield which reliably safeguards the peace on the Korean Peninsula and the security of the nation and a powerful driving force advancing the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 The Songun policy reflects the most patriotic will to realize with arms of justice the ardent desire of the nation for independent reunification and national prosperity as it is a great political mode for ushering in a new era of independence and dignity.
					
					 It serves as a symbol of national sovereignty and dignity today because it represents the iron will to punish without fail anyone who encroaches upon every tree and even a blade of grass in the country and hurts the dignity of the Korean nation no matter from where the intruder comes.
					
					The matchless and ever-victorious Songun policy and military deterrent in the DPRK are like a powerful treasured sword and invincible shield as they reliably safeguard and guarantee the peace of the country and national security from foreign aggression. It is thanks to the army of Songun which serves as a powerful treasured sword defending peace that the moves of the foreign aggressor forces to ignite a new war are checked and frustrated on the Korean Peninsula and the peace of the country and national security are guaranteed. 
					
					Kim Jong Il possessed of such disposition as love for his country and nation provided the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration based on the principle of national independence under the banner of Songun, putting the movement for national reunification on a new higher stage. It is quite natural for the Koreans from all walks of life at home and abroad to highly praise the Songun policy, which demonstrates its tremendous vitality in practice, as the greatest patriotic policy which saves the nation and carves out a bright future of reunification and prosperity and support and defend it irrespective of ideology, political view and religious faith.
					
					 The WPK will as ever powerfully encourage all the Koreans in their efforts to achieve independent reunification and peace and prosperity, reliably guaranteeing the cause of national reunification and decisively shattering the anti-reunification forces' moves with matchless arms, concludes the article.

articles.title: Puppet Authorities' Suppression of Young Patriot Slashed
articles.content:
Puppet Authorities' Suppression of Young Patriot Slashed
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The Action Headquarters of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration to Force the Lee Myung Bak Regime to Step Down in south Korea in a statement issued on Feb. 6 denounced the puppet authorities for their unreasonable suppression of a young pro-reunification patriot.
					 The statement referred to the fact that the court bench held a trial on Feb. 5 at which it sentenced Kim Pok Gi, executive chairperson of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, to a jail term, suspension of qualification and fine.
					
					 The attitude of the court bench can never be pardoned as it unilaterally sided with the prosecution forsaken and denounced by the people, the statement charged, bitterly condemning the court bench for sentencing Kim to penal servitude, to serve the treacherous regime hell-bent on killing people.
					
					 The statement stressed that the crackdown upon people intensified by the security forces, siding with those in power, would only give further momentum to the all-people resistance movement for forcing the Lee regime to step down.

articles.title: Candlelight Memorial Services Continue in S. Korea
articles.content:
Candlelight Memorial Services Continue in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Candlelight rallies mourning the dead evacuees of Ryongsan go on in Seoul.
					The participants of the candlelight rally held on Feb. 8 declared that they would never pardon the killers of the evacuees, accusing the "government" of blindfolding the eyes of the people and stopping their ears over the issue of the killing of evacuees in Ryongsan.
					
					Noting that the era of barbarians has come to this land, they called for eliminating through a struggle those who advocate the material-almighty idea, disregarding human beings.
					
					More citizens would turn out in the protest against the wrong results of investigation into the incident in Ryongsan announced by the prosecution, they warned. 
					
					On the same day the security authorities set up a barricade in the Chonggye Plaza and the roads leading to it by mobilizing at least 300 policemen and more than 40 police buses and perpetrated such rowdyism as arresting citizens and bereaved families of the victims even while the rally was under way.

articles.title: Seminar of Korean Social Scientists in Japan Held to Observe February Holiday
articles.content:
Seminar of Korean Social Scientists in Japan Held to Observe February Holiday
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- A seminar of Korean social scientists in Japan took place in Tokyo on Feb. 7 to celebrate February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					It was attended by Kim Hwa Hyo, chairman of the Association of Korean Social Scientists in Japan, Korean social scientists and officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					
					The seminar heard a speech made on the subject "Homeland that has greeted the era of a new great revolutionary surge" and other speeches. 
					
					The speakers referred to the fact that the people in the homeland are effecting great innovations and leaps forward day by day with the extraordinary determination to open the gate to building a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012 at any cost holding aloft the torch of a new great revolutionary surge personally kindled by Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They spoke highly of the shining successes reported from the homeland, noting that there breaks the dawn of a new historic era in which President Kim Il Sung's cause of building a rich and powerful country and the centuries-old desire of the Koreans in Japan and all other Koreans will become a reality. 
					
					 They vowed to make redoubled efforts to accomplish the patriotic cause of Chongryon full of firm conviction of victory true to the grandiose plan of the leader to achieve the historic cause of building a great prosperous and powerful nation under the banner of Songun.

articles.title: Statement of Spokesman for KPA General Staff Supported in Ecuador
articles.content:
Statement of Spokesman for KPA General Staff Supported in Ecuador
 Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The International Department of the Socialist Party-Ample Front and the Canar Provincial Institute for the Friendship and Solidarity with the DPRK of Ecuador released a joint statement on Jan. 27 in support of the statement issued by a spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army which declared that the KPA would honorably defend the territory of the country by smashing all kinds of obstructive moves on the part of traitor Lee Myung Bak.
					 The statement said that it is the noble mission of the world revolutionaries to wage the movement for solidarity with the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					Noting that reunification of Korea is the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk, three commanders of Mt. Paektu, it clarified that the DPRK has taken many just measures for the reunification of the nation and durable peace.
					
					 It denounced traitor Lee Myung Bak for committing acts of checking reunification of Korea without hesitation, kowtowing to the imperialists this year.
					
					 The statement indicted the Lee clique before the world for threatening world peace and strongly condemned them, expressing invariable solidarity with the Korean people.

articles.title: RPDC nombra el ministro de las FAP y el jefe de EMG del EPC
articles.content:
RPDC nombra el ministro de las FAP y el jefe de EMG del EPC
Pyongyang, 11 de febrero (ATCC) -- Fue publicada el dia 11 a nombre del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional (CDN) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea (RPDC) y la Comision Militar Central (CMC) del Partido del Trabajo de Corea (PTC) la resolucion del CDN y de la CMC.
					 Segun el documento fue nombrado el vicemariscal del EPC, Kim Yong Chun, como ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares (FAP) del CDN de la RPDC y el general de ejercito del EPC, Ri Yong Ho, como jefe del Estado Mayor General (EMG) del EPC.

articles.title: Inaugurado ciclo de cine por el 16 de febrero
articles.content:
Inaugurado ciclo de cine por el 16 de febrero
Pyongyang, 11 de febrero (ATCC) -- Como parte de las festividades por el 16 de febrero (cumpleanos del Dirigente Kim Jong Il), quedo inaugurado el dia 11 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el ciclo de cine.
					En esta ocasion se proyectaran en los cines y las casas culturales capitalinos y locales los largometrajes que describen en escenas emotivas las inmortales hazanas de guia del Dirigente
						Kim Jong Il y la indoblegable potencia espiritual del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea que se manifiesta en la construccion de una patria prospera.
					
					Entre ellos hay los documentales "Visita de orientacion a varios sectores del gran Dirigente, camarada Kim Jong Il", "Para realizar el anhelo del Presidente", "El 16 de febrero, gran fiesta nacional" y otros, y las peliculas de ficcion "Una foto dejada por el", "El piloto Kil Yong Jo", "Los habitantes de la provincia de Jagang", "El secretario responsable de Taehongdan", "El diario de una estudiante" y otras.
					
					 El ministro de Cultura Kang Nung Su pronuncio la palabra inaugural.
					
					 Terminada la ceremonia inaugural, los participantes vieron la pelicula "La imagen de un soldado".
					
					 El mismo dia, el ciclo de cine quedo iniciado tambien en todas las provincias.

articles.title: Inaugurada Exposicion Central de Bellas Artes por 16 de febrero
articles.content:
Inaugurada Exposicion Central de Bellas Artes por 16 de febrero
Pyongyang, 11 de febrero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del cumpleanos (16 de febrero) del Dirigente
					Kim Jong Il  quedo inaugurada el dia 11 en el Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang la exposicion central de bellas artes.
					 Estan exhibidas ahi mas de 70 obras de bellas artes de valor del  tesoro nacional, incluidas las obras que muestran las hazanas revolucionarias de los 3 Generales del monte Paektu y sus nobles rasgos.
					
					 Las pinturas al estilo coreano "La fiesta de febrero en visperas de la liberacion de la patria" y "Hacia la patria" describen las inmortales hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung y la heroina de la lucha antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk quienes criaron al Dirigente Kim Jong Il, lucero del Paektu, para que la nacion coreana gozara de generacion en generacion la fortuna de tener al gran  Lider y al  gran General.
					
					 Las pinturas acrilicas "El gran Dirigente, camarada Kim Jong Il quien visito el lugar de construccion del Conjunto Monumental de Samjiyon", "!Corea, te hare grande!", etc. describen bien las nobles imagenes del Dirigente.
					
					 La pintura al oleo "El gran Dirigente, camarada  Kim Jong Il quien visito los obreros del Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean" y el dibujo al estilo coreano "Diciendo que es el orgulloso paisaje de la epoca del Songun" y otras obras muestran los grandes rasgos de direccion del Dirigente.
					
					 En el acto inaugural participaron el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Kim Ki Nam, el ministro de Cultura Kang Nung Su, creadores de bellas artes y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam pronuncio la palabra inaugural.

articles.title: RPDC gana a Arabia Saudita en clasificatorias asiaticas
articles.content:
RPDC gana a Arabia Saudita en clasificatorias asiaticas
 Pyongyang, 11 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este miercoles en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung el partido de futbol entre el equipo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el de Arabia Saudita como parte de la fase final de las clasificatorias asiaticas para la Copa Mundial 2010 de la FIFA.
					 En este encuentro el equipo coreano gano al once visitante por 1:0.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena Israel por uso de armas de destruccion masiva
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena Israel por uso de armas de destruccion masiva 
Pyongyang, 11 de febrero (ATCC) -- Durante la reciente invasion a la Franja de Gaza, los agresores israelies lanzaron misiles y bombas en serie y mandaron tanques a esta urbe pacifica bajo el pretexto de eliminar a las fuerzas paramilitares de Hamas.
					Como si esto fuera poco, tiraron indiscriminadamente contra los poblados las bombas prohibidas rigurosamente en la arena internacional, como la de fosforo blanco, material veneno, y la de uranio empobrecido, sustancia radiactiva.
					
					Ademas, usaron hasta la DIME (bomba metalica inactiva de alta densidad), arma letal y causante del cancer, desarrollada por Estados Unidos.
					
					En un comentario individual divulgado hoy, el rotativo Minju Joson califica esta inhumanitaria operacion genocida de Israel de peor violacion de DDHH sin precedente en este mundo.
					
					Citando datos, el comentarista revela que el pais hebreo comete la agresion militar a Palestina y el asesinato de los civiles con las armas letales suministradas por EE.UU. imitando a este imperio que viola los derechos humanos actuando con arbitrariedad y despotismo sin tomar en consideracion la ley internacional ni los DDHH, y prosigue:
					
					 Al usar indiscriminadamente las armas de homicidio masivo rehusando la demanda de la opinion publica del mundo, los imperialistas norteamericanos y los agresores israelies muestran por si solos que son bestias enloquecidas por la agresion, la guerra y el genocidio, asesinos de igual calana que viven de la violacion de DDHH y enemigos jurados de la humanidad.
					
					EE.UU., que habla tanto del "respeto a los DDHH" a la vista del mundo, no toma en consideracion la observacion de la ley internacional ni el ideal de respeto a los DDHH para lograr sus objetivos agresivos y de rapina.
					
					A citar un buen ejemplo de ello, EE.UU. no solo usa dichas armas asesinas sino tambien las entrega a Israel que las uso contra los civiles causando terribles desastres.
					
					Por muy desesperados que fueran los esfuerzos de Israel por encubrir sus crimenes de violacion de DDHH, nunca podra evadir la severa sentencia de la sociedad internacional aspirante a la justicia.
